Comment: if you go when it is a high tide the Mosque actually looks as if it is floating on water. wonderful architecture and a view to die for. the mosque is very grand and it looks even better with all the lights on. it is easy excess by bus 101 which stops in front of the mosque on Fridays as there are a lot of people going for Juma prayers on Friday. on other days the driver will drop you off at the entrance if you tell him/her.it is a very relaxing walk around it as all you can see is the beautiful Seaview

Name: The Floating Mosque

Name: The Floating Mosque

Name: The Floating Mosque

Name: The Floating Mosque

Name: The Floating Mosque

Name: The Floating Mosque

Name: The Floating Mosque

Name: The Floating Mosque

Name: The Floating Mosque
Comment: Though standing on stilts, this is a solid-concrete-built mosque with a tall tower, a hard-scaped front area (which is also on stilts either completely or partially) and a beautiful walkway lined with flower pots leading to the front entrance of the building; and there are also small tables with chairs and some benches like on three sides just outside the building where you can sit down & enjoy the views of the sea right beside (a pretty nice "wide-open" view of the sea really, not a harbor view with land on the other side like you would see in George Town).  Also be sure to go inside and see the "quite-magnificent" domed ceiling with these four-sided shapes (like diamonds or something, kind of interesting to me), and there's also an upper gallery above although I believe it's off-limits to the public; and they do provide some clothing piece for those wearing shorts to go inside, so it's ok if you don't come wearing long pants.  Overall, this is a worthwhile mosque to visit (for its tranquillity by the sea & the beautiful domed ceiling inside as mentioned above) although it may not be as convenient to get to (depending on where you're staying) as Kapitan Keling Mosque in the George Town heritage area.Coming by bus, the 101 & 102 buses stop pretty much right in front of the Mosque (across the street if you're coming from the direction of George Town and going toward Batu Ferringhi); or if you're staying at hotels like Flamingo and Copthorne Orchid, it's just about a half-hour walk to here from those places (turn right after coming out of those places and just go straight on that road).

Name: The Floating Mosque

Name: The Floating Mosque
Comment: We started our second day at Penang with a visit to this masque and were much impressed by the way in which the mosque is maintained and by the friendly people there.

Name: The Floating Mosque
Comment: Built in the sea supported by strong concrete pillars. It does not actually 'float' as the name would suggest rather it stands on water and when it is high tide it appears to be floating on water when you look at it from certain angles. If you are Muslim, then you can pray anytime as it remains open (unlike in many Islamic countries where mosques close straight after prays). If you are visiting for the view then the best time to visit will be before the magrib pray (before sunset). The mosque has car parking however I got there by a cheap uber journey from George Town as we were not driving when in Penang. If you are visiting during the day you will see the locals on the beach fishing by using fishing nets. It's amazing how much success they have by using these small nets- feel free to join them as many welcome foreignersThe hop- on, hop off tourist bus route 2 will also drop you off near the mosque although you may end up waiting for a while due to frequency of route 2. There is a women section for praying including separate female wash facilities. You can take many pictures. Please respect local dress code when visiting the mosque. My wife had purchased a cheap cultural clothing and scarf for visits  to Malaysian mosques. For Muslim travellers please note there is a Friday Jamat at the mosque.

Name: The Floating Mosque

Name: The Floating Mosque
Comment: During last year Chinese New Year, I visited a friend who stayed at a condominum at Tanjung Bungah and from the condominum I could see the beautiful floating mosque directly at the base of the condo. That was the first time I learnt the term `floating mosque'. In my mind, I was then visualizing that the mosque was floating on the sea. I wonder if the mosque really float in the sea? I was excited to find out how maritime technology is so advanced as to make a mosque float in the sea. Along the way to the mosque, I bypassed a restaurant located just opposite the mosque at the same side of my friend's condo. I was attracted by the number of patrons queuing for breakfast there and I joined in the queue to have my nasi lemak. It was terriffic good and reasonably cheap. I love this traditional food here. The mosque is located near a bend and the traffic at the bend was not light. You have to be careful crossing the road from the condo to the mosque. There is a free car park for vehicles to park just at the front of the mosque. You are free to roam around outside the prayer hall and I like the sea scenery here. You can see sampans moored at the sea and feel the cool sea winds blowing on your face as you gazed towards the vast horizon. The beach further down the road at the extreme right of the mosque was once hit by the dreadful tsunami. There were two blocks of flats located just next to the mosque that were constructed for the victims of the tsunami. As I looked at the few isolated fishing sampans that laid unattended at the quiet beach in front of the blocks of flats, my thoughts went philosphical. We are so fragile a creature on this vast land, many events are unpredictable and life could just be destroyed and diminished within split second of a disaster. I heard from someone that this floating mosque was spared unscathed during the disaster and pondered how it had witnessed the bitter suffering of those who perished in the dreadful torrential waves. I realized that the mosque was not floating without a foundation. It has a strong solid piling that anchor it deep into the sea bed of Penang. While it faces the sea, its beauty lies with the people of the Land and with its continual blessing to this wonderful island and people of Penang.

Name: The Floating Mosque

And gather the community to try and clean it once a week. When going in one must cover their head, and no skirts, short pants should go in.

Comment: It would be best to visit this mosque outside of prayer times. The car park was empty when we came at 2pm, as was the mosque. Despite the low tide, the setting of this mosque was very beautiful, overlooking the sand and sea. The building sports a large dome with a dazzling pattern on the ceiling, to match the carpet pattern underneath (see my photos).As a non-Muslim it always feels a bit uncomfortable entering a mosque, and needless to say, more so for my wife, who although she came prepared with the head gear, was forbidden to enter the main prayer hall. There is a separate section for women, as indicated by the signage. Having said that, we were not approached and were left free to wander the premises at will, which I did. It‚Äôs seems they are not used to receiving tourists here.The mosque is located at the beginning of the ascent up the mountain heading towards Batu Ferringhi from Georgetown. If you‚Äôre on your way to either town it would be worth a stop-over to visit this mosque. The 101 bus goes right by. There are some food stalls out front, and bathroom facilities inside.

Name: Aquarium of Fisheries Research Institute
Comment: The first time I went to this aquarium must have been nearly 40 years ago. After that, the 2nd time I went was 10 years ago. My review is for the most recent visit which was just a few days ago.I was pleased with the recent visit because they have expanded this aquarium to have more fish tanks which are designed well (except for the fact that some tanks are too high for toddlers to see). The ticket prices are really cheap and you can easily spend a happy hour with your family. While you won't get the expensive crowd-pleasers like seals, dolphins and sharks, there's enough attractive fish and turtles and the whole area is pleasing enough.Recommended if you are in the area.

Name: Aquarium of Fisheries Research Institute
Comment: The entrance fee is cheap.Disabled/Handicapped-friendly.Informative.Some of the displays are quite high, kids would not be able to see.Free parking is provided, not so crowded.Takes about 1 hour plus for tour around the aquarium.

Name: Aquarium of Fisheries Research Institute
Comment: It is named after the first prime minister of our country, the late Tunku Abdul Rahman. Located in Batu Maung at the far end of the Penang island. It is a small aquarium with limited number of marine species on display but it is clean and well-maintained. It is fully air-conditioned inside and has a big auditorium where visitors can sit and view the giant fishes swimming gracefully in the biggest tank of the aquarium. There is an outdoor section with ponds and a skeletal remains of a whale. There is also a small souvenir shop near the exit.The entrance fee is very low, only RM5 for adults, RM2 for children and Free for senior citizens above 55 years old. School children who come in a group pay only RM1.50 each. Unlike most other places of interest, the above rates at this aquarium apply to both local residents as well as foreign visitors. People with disabilities are also allowed to enter for free. However, please take note of the opening days and hours. It is open every day except on Wednesdays. Opening hours are from 10.00 a.m. to 5.00 p.m. Last entry is at 4.30 p.m. On Mondays, Tuesdays and Thursdays, it is closed from 1.00 p.m. to 2.00 p.m. for lunch. On Fridays, it is closed from 12.15 p.m. to 2.45 p.m. Please refer to the photographs attached.It is worth a visit, especially if you are thinking of giving your children an introductory tour of an aquarium. A big parking area in the compound.

Name: Aquarium of Fisheries Research Institute
Comment: Pretty nice done small but informative aquarium. Unfortunately it's a little far from the city center. Would I recommend the time to get here? Put it this way, it's nice although I felt with many tanks sad with the fish/turtles, small and not much for the fish to do than hanging in there until they die. But there is a good collection of freshwater fish including some larger fish too. But like I said, without a car and time on your hands...

Name: Aquarium of Fisheries Research Institute
Comment: Nice aquarium, small but inexpensive. Another quick attraction when driving out to the snake temple.

Name: Aquarium of Fisheries Research Institute
Comment: Good place, cheap and lots of fish. There are also restaurants at the end which is nice. Kids will love it.

Name: Aquarium of Fisheries Research Institute
Comment: We popped in to see the aquarium after visiting the nearby war museum. It's not particularly obvious that its there, as it sits to the side of the fisheries research centre, and the signage is in Malay only. Entry is only 5RM for adults, foreigners and Malaysians. Lots of tanks and different fish. Sad there are so many vulnerable and endangered species. Also sad how we are ruining the oceans with plastic - the aquarium has a simple but effective display in this regard. We all loved the turtles. Getting back to Georgetown is difficult. No taxis, and the bus takes a very long time.

Name: Aquarium of Fisheries Research Institute
Comment: Well worth a visit for an 1-11/2 hoursLoads of infoGood displays Lots of fish.......  no surprise there Overall clean and looked after tanka We were only people there for most of time at 11amVery helpful staff pointing us to main office for free WiFi to get grab taxi away Thanks Recommended for out of sun visit or even wet day or any reallyRefreshment available

Name: Aquarium of Fisheries Research Institute
Comment: A very well organised aquarium. Description is provided for most of the fish, shell etc. Turtles are most popular to children

Name: Aquarium of Fisheries Research Institute
Comment: Small yet educational fishing aquarium... for  a small fee to pay, you will get a nice short experience within the walk within the aquarium.. all the aquarium are well kept and clean. It showcase fishes and turtles..

Name: Aquarium of Fisheries Research Institute
Comment: of coz i promote this place, value for money. only RM5 for adult, RM3 for kid, Free for senior citizen. had souvenir shop and cafe to chill up. free parking.

Name: Aquarium of Fisheries Research Institute
Comment: It's a great place for what it is. RM5 per adult, RM2 per child 7yrs and over. Free for senior citizens.It's not very well advertised/promoted/marketed which is a shame, as I'm sure it'll attract more visitors.Some people have compared this to bigger attractions such as Langkawi's underwater world which is about 10 times the price.

Name: Aquarium of Fisheries Research Institute
Comment: I was a little disappointed because I expected it to be big - like the one in Langkawi.  This one is much smaller but still worth a visit if you like to see fishes and other sea life.  Entry fee was only MYR5 (dirt cheap).

Name: Aquarium of Fisheries Research Institute
Comment: It was RM5 for adult and free for senior citizen (aged 55 and above). They had a good variety of fishes with a surprising number of turtles. They also had seahorses and lobsters as well as a couple of nurse sharks. Don't expect anything super amazing and you won't be disappointed.

Name: Aquarium of Fisheries Research Institute
Comment: I was there with my wife on Friday and we were so disappointed with the management decision on closing the tickets counter for two hours from 12.15 noon to 2pm on every Friday. Come on, management.. You still able to hire Chinese or Indians or Nepalese. Don't practice this stupidity again..

Name: Aquarium of Fisheries Research Institute
Comment: This attraction has to one of the cheapest attraction on Penang which is open daily except on Wednesday from 10.00am until 5.00pm, which is run by the Fisheries Research Institute/Institute Penyelidikan Perikanan (FRI Batu Maung) which is located opposite the Penang War Museum‚Äôs Junction.Admission is priced at RM 5.00 per adult; RM 2.00 for children between 7-12 years old and free admission for children below 7 years old and disable person / senior citizen above the age of 55.There are different sections; such on fresh water fishes; plants and most interestingly is the underwater sea world with sharks and not forgetting the smaller aquariums with Jellyfishes and seahorses!You could also purchase small packet of food from the souvenir centre to feed the koi fishes in the Koi ponds, which never ceases to amaze kids young and old‚Ä¶It was a great experience and definitely a place for kids.

Name: Aquarium of Fisheries Research Institute
Comment: As this week is school holidays so we decided to take the grandchildren to the Aquarium.It took us a while to find the place as it is off the main truck road and also there were roadworks so the direct access was detoured.Once we got there the little girls were excited. Though it was only a small place but it was enough to keep the little ones occupied and glued to the glass to look at the many colourful and species of fish.As we are senior citizens and the little girls were under 7 years old so we need not pay any entrance fee. The entrance fee is RM 5 for an adult.It was cooled and spacious indoors. There was also a canteen where food and drinks were sold.All in all it was a day well spent.It is a great place for a Family outing and very educational.We will be back again.

Name: Aquarium of Fisheries Research Institute
Comment: They was a miniature research aquarium at Penang...entrance fee only Rm 5 for adults but for the citizen over 55years will be free....You can travel either by your own car...our public bus to Batu Maung..Inside seem a lot of fisheries..colourful fishs...turtles.....It was another nice placeyou must visit at Penang...

Name: Teluk Bahang Beach
Comment: I had a look around this beach today and it's quite nice. Had to walk through someone's yard to get to it.

Name: Teluk Bahang Beach
Comment: What a sleepy town this is. I guess most tourists stop at the park, but I cycled around town without seeing a living soul... boats were resting until evening, I assume. An eery sensation!

Name: Teluk Bahang Beach
Comment: The Teluk Bahang Beach is home to many fishermen in Penang. The place is still very much laid back today compare to the busy Georgetown, offering old rustic relax feel.Nearby is the Penang National Park, the smallest National Park in the world! The Pantai Kerachut adinkey Beach of the Park are famous for their clear water and white sandy beaches.

Name: Teluk Bahang Beach
Comment: This is our favourite beach of the area. It is a little bit of a hike to get to but well worth it. It has a place to camp (will definitely be coming back in the future to camp), toilet blocks, a little mosque and several other little buildings. To get here you take a turn off 3/4 of the way to Kerachut Beach. (it is well posted) From there the path get a little steep and would be better suited for those with am average + fitness level. At the time we did the trail the little bridges crossing the rivers just before the beach where broken and in need of repair. Still crossable but very dodgy. The beach itself if awesome. I came here on a Tuesday and I saw no one at all. There was a good amount of monkeys running around and a nice chilled out vibe. There was a lot of jellyfish though so unfortunately no swimming. You will need to bring food and drinks with you for this beach as it is quite far fro the main national park gate. It is a lovely hike and a good way to spend the day out the in jungle. (Again I would advise you do need a fair fitness level to do this hike)Overall it is a good beach to come to hang out and have a good relaxing day away from the crowds.

Name: Teluk Bahang Beach
Comment: 1. We drove from our hotel at Tanjung Bunga & it take us about 40min slow drive to reach Teluk Bahang Beach. It almost right at the end of the roads.2. A lot of shop & it a local fisherman village. They organise islands hoping your at reasonable fee.3. It nice to slow walk at the esplanade & enjoy our afternoon walk.4. A lot of small shop selling local dish at reasonable price. The good news, most of them able to converse in English.

Name: Teluk Bahang Beach
Comment: This is a smaller beach just before Batu Ferringhi as you head towards it from Georgetown.Not a lot of people when we there, the water did look a little murky.

Name: Teluk Bahang Beach
Comment: By using rapid penang bus, we can reach this beach 3.40 RM/one way. Actually this bus will also pass to batu feringgi beach. This beach also clean..

Name: Teluk Bahang Beach
Comment: many choice menu include Crabs, shells, fish and any local seafood available here and great staff.I have seen much better beaches. Really don't know why people think it is so marvellous but still ok. Not a place that I would like to go and spend some time at. It is not even that big a place to feel that you can enjoy your time there.

Name: Teluk Bahang Beach
Comment: We visited this beach during June 2017. BEach is good, view is ok but beach is small compared to traditional beach. But must visit one time if you are visiting Penang.

Name: Teluk Bahang Beach
Comment: foods are okay, service not so satisfying. maybe due to the crowd.the varieties of fresh seafood are commendable.

Name: Teluk Bahang Beach
Comment: If you travelling to Penang , you must come to eat seafood in Fishing Village, very fresh and the price also reasonable , especially butter prawn  is super tasty. We enjoyed eating here, clean and staff also friendly.

Name: Teluk Bahang Beach
Comment: This is the start or end pointfor a visit to the National Park.  You can take a boat to the park from the beach, and then hike overland to Teluk Bahang proper tat h a bus to the interchange lower down the road before switching to the bus to Batu Ferringi or Georgetown.  The place itself is a quiet Malay village, with small eateries and some motels.  If yiu are hungry, there is a decent Nasi Padang stall near the busstop, where you can order nasi campur (you place various items like beef rendang, fried fish or 4 corner beans and the lady will charge you at your table)

Name: Teluk Bahang Beach
Comment: Here the beach is more empty compared to Tanjong Bungah asthere are fewer food stalls and no merchandise shops.Howeverthe situation will change when buildings now under construction open

Name: Teluk Bahang Beach
Comment: Don't use the one by the roundabout bu turn right and go to the end of the road for more choices of seafood restaurants.Crabs, shells, fish and any local seafood available here.Chinese style but spicy like all Malaysian food.

Name: Teluk Bahang Beach
Comment: The beach was not the most pristine, and I would not recommend swimming in. There were vendors that provided refreshments and dent snacks, I don't see any lifeguard huts during my visit and there were not many amenities, like change rooms, clean washrooms, Tried the seafood, was not impressed, too spicy for my taste. Prices seemed a little high compared to town prices.but if you want a quick stop, spend a few fun hours, it's not a bad place to checkout

Name: Teluk Bahang Beach
Comment: Interesting fish jetty but not much of the old charm left.If you bring a picnic and hike around towards the national park there are some nice spots.

Name: Teluk Bahang Beach
Comment: Had dinner here. Decently priced seafood with fresh selections. Do asked for Crabs with eggs if you love them and fresh steamed fish.

Name: Teluk Bahang Beach
Comment: 1. Enjoy the wonderful jetty. They still maintained the wooden jetty for you enjoy them.2. You can walk from here to Sungai Tukun where you can get free fish spa and swim in the stream. 3. Toilet provided.4. There is canopy walk. But nothing to shout about.5. You can take trekking tour for trekking to Pantai Kerachut. There are several trails for you to try.

Name: Teluk Bahang Beach
Comment: Beautiful beach compared to the rest of Penang. It's further up north but cleaner and worth the travels. Plenty of fruit orchards nearby as well and it's quiet, away from all the hustle and bustle of Georgetown or the main Ferringhi area.

Name: Teluk Bahang Beach
Comment: just walk around from our hotel. slowly walk in teluk bahang beach just give our child had experiance to catch the wave and play with the sand.

Name: Teluk Bahang Beach
Comment: I have seen much better beaches.  Really don't know why people think it is so marvellous.  The place is filthy dirty.  The water is dirty. Not a place that I would like to go and spend some time at.  It is not even that big a place to feel that you can enjoy your time there. No amenities available.

Name: Teluk Bahang Beach
Comment: Teluk Bahang beach lies after Batu Ferringhi to the fishing village at the end of Teluk Bahang road. It is a long stretch of beach which is very popular for exercise among locals. A great place to walk or jog. A quiet and peaceful area, we used to camp here at the Jamboree Campsite during our school days. Nice for a picnic and to enjoy the beach away from the hotel crowd. If you want to swim, be careful of jelly fish.

Name: Teluk Bahang Beach
Comment: Like the hotel that is close to beach, nice weather. Bus stop is just outside the hotel, easily accessed to Gurney Drive. Dislike the foot massage experience. Can't find nice Roti Prata and Teh Tarik.

Name: Teluk Bahang Beach
Comment: Tanjong Bungah beach is not the cleanest beach I've been to. Liked the stay at the hotel but not really the beach

Name: Teluk Bahang Beach
Comment: Very peaceful, water warm, just great to relax, no one pestering you. Ideal place to get away from crowds

Name: Teluk Bahang Beach
Comment: The Four Points by Sheraton Hotel is situated on this beach which is not overcrowded like Batu Ferringhi. A rare sight one morning was to see a group of about dozen large monitor(?) lizards swimming along the beachfront & then around the next headland.

Name: Teluk Bahang Beach
Comment: The beach is full of private operated company who sells you all sorts of games like sea scooters, parachute by speed boat and many more which you can name along the stretch of the whole beach. There are lots of tourists too so you don't expect to stay alone anywhere. It's for the active ones, not so much if you want to share romantic time with your partner.

Name: Teluk Bahang Beach
Comment: Another revisit...Slightly cloudy water looks inviting but definitely not a good idea for swimming. Jellyfish are more or less seasonal, pollution is year round. If you like noisy water sports this might be for you. If you want some peace and quiet, it isn't. The jungle trail is poorly maintained and at times frankly hazardous, so better go accompanied. Monkey Beach was a mass of discarded polystyrene containers when I got there. All in all, the bus ride to get there is maybe the best part, and there are a couple of decent restaurants along with the local stalls. Other nearby attractions such as the tropical fruit farm and butterfly farm (and roadside durian  in June-July season) can be recommended without all these reservations.

Name: Teluk Bahang Beach
Comment: It is impossible swimming because the sea is contaminated and full of jellyfish. One advice, if gou don't see the locals sweeming you do the same

Name: Teluk Bahang Beach
Comment: The beach was really unsuitable  for swimming. Jelly Fish, Polluted etc. But perfect for water sports such as parasailing, jet skiing

Name: Teluk Bahang Beach
Comment: A great location not far from George Town. Beach a bit small and water a bit  uninviting. Good bus service right at the door to all locations

Name: Teluk Bahang Beach
Comment: Me and my family enjoyed very much , we can spend one evening over here .must visit for all age groups ...S M Bega Raaj

Name: Teluk Bahang Beach
Comment: Nice beach to walk along and let the kids run wild, but not good for swimming in March as there were too many jelly fish!

Name: Teluk Bahang Beach
Comment: Jelly Fish and garbage in the water and along the shoreline. Walked the beach each morning however was never ever likely to take the plunge.

Name: Teluk Bahang Beach
Comment: I always brought my friends here whenever they are in Penang for a holiday. Usually I will bring them here by 6pm to enjoy the early evening while having a cooling drink at one of the many cafes/bistros scattered around the beach. This will be followed by a dinner at this area and then some sightseeing and shopping at the daily night market. The night will end with some beers and snack foods again at one of the many cafes/bistros at this area.

Name: Teluk Bahang Beach
Comment: lovely beach although I say immediately that swimming is a definite no-no! tourists/foreigners can/may be "chatted up" by local beach boys so be aware!

Name: Teluk Bahang Beach
Comment: This area was formally declared as a National Park in 2006 and was given a huge injection of capital to create infrastructure around the river which runs to the beach. Paths were created and made more accessible. However, since then money has not been forthcoming and many of the facilities have not been maintained. The canopy walk is still functional but it is reached via a ghost town of seating and rest areas, swimming holes and other disused buildings. The paths are patchy and littered with the skeletons of former development projects in the park. The walk to monkey beach and the lighthouse is gruelling and at times dangerous. Most importantly of all DO NOT DRINK OR BATHE IN THE FRESH WATER as it is infested with bacteria. A small sign warns of this but only after you have passed many of the concrete swimming holes. All in all it is a very pleasant walk but nothing special. do it if you have a day to kill.

Name: Teluk Bahang Beach
Comment: Teluk Bahang Beach--behind the old Mutiara Beach Resort--is the most beautiful stretch of pristine beach in north Penang.  You won't be hassled by people trying to get you to ride a horse or jet ski, nor will you choke at sunset on the exhaust from Land Rovers pulling boats in (all problems at Batu Feringghi beach).  It's pure unspoiled nature, a gently sloping beach safe for young ones to play at, and with the excellent Fisherman's Village Seafood restaurant nearby.

Name: Teluk Bahang Beach
Comment: Beach not that great and lots of water sports going on. Pretty busy on weekend. Too many hassling you to do things

Name: Teluk Bahang Beach
Comment: Driving into Teluk Bahung, we turned towards the beach at the main roundabout. Following the road around to the right, we came upon a small but pretty beach with fishing boats moored off the coast (see my photos).Alighting from our vehicle we were greeted by Rahim, the manager of the small guest house on the beach where we had stopped. It is rather isolated here, with only one restaurant nearby at the roundabout (pictured).If you really want to get away from the tourist scene of Batu Ferringhi and hang with the locals, then this just might be the place for you. Otherwise, it doesn't look like there is much to do here.

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: A hidden gem of a museum tucked inside the DoubleTree Resort. While it does have a one-room gallery about the history of teddy bears, its main feature is recreating historical and cultural scenes of Penang through miniature and larger-than-life-sized displays and models. I felt like I got a whole overview of Penang just by looking at the exhibits, such as the British colonization, hawkers' markets, and Kek Lok Si temple. Even my 60 year-old aunt, who grew up and lived in George Town her whole life, didn't know about this place and left quite impressed! Definitely an attraction that would delight children, but would also be of interest to anyone interested in a unique take on the history & culture of Penang.

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: This museum surprised me. I expected a typical museum with the history of variety of toys. However, it demonstrates the culture and history of Penang in such a creative and lovely manner, so I read every piece of information on the walls.

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: Apart from the first 'room', this isn't a teddy bear museum. Rather, each room has something about the history or culture of Penang and Malaysia, with life-size + teddy bears dressed to represent the information. Kids (little kids) may enjoy the teddy bear representatives, teens would be bored senseless, and we only went through because we had free entry tickets.

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: Stayed at the Hilton which houses the TeddyVille. Excellent insight into the history of teddy bears and also Penang. Surprised me a lot and certainly worth going.

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: For teddy fan you should give a try visiting this museum. You will get a knowledge of the teddy story. There's a lot of pictures can be taken. It's located in the Doubletree by Hilton hotel. At the end of tour you may ask the staff to take a picture of you and family. Also there's a discount given if you buy the merchandise here.

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: This place is well worth visiting.Don't miss it.  It is not a cheesy gimmick but a quality series of displays.  Do it after you have toured penang and you will recognise places you have seen, learn more about them  and have your experiences enhanced.  Quite stylish not just a collection of toys.Attention to detail, intricate and fun for all not just the kids.We went early on our second last day,  had a buffet breakfast as a treat at the hilton and then spent an hour or so here, and took a grab back to town.  Fantastic.  Do it.

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: Really enjoyed my visit to this place. It is located at the ground floor of the doubletree hotel.If you are a hotel customer you get a reasonably fair discount for the entrance fees. For a teddy lover this place was just mesmerizing in terms of all the teddy bears put up for exhibition as well as the placards put up detailing the historical trail of teddy bears. Children would enjoy this place most likely though those adults who have always had a soft spot for teddy bears would be equally at home here! Its a great place for foreigners to get a glimpse of the essence of penang -via the teddy models.For me it was a well spent afternoon!

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: Never expected an adult like me who does not fancy teddy bears to be captivated by it. Kudos for putting in so much effort on the detailness. Definitely a must visit place !

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: Happen to be in the hotel that we are staying and decided to bring my toddler to have a look. Initially I did not pin high hopes on seeing alot of teddy bears as it seem to be a small place to go. However to my surprise that there are really quite a numbers of them. They are group and dresses in races which is quite fun for us to walk around. Would say it's a place for kids to see all the teddy bears.

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: Very adorable with cute and culldy Teddy bears, they use bears to show the history or Malaysia, the ticket come with Rm10 voucher so you can use to purchase gift at the gift shop

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: The museum is nice to be learnt the history of teddy. All of staffs are friendly and helpful. My friend and I are really impressed this place.

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: What a great little museum! Really fun and very informative!! Learnt all about history and culture of penang in here, which didn't expect. Our guide round the museum,  Connie, was fantastic and all the staff were really friendly. Definitely add it to you list if your visiting batu ferringhi or george town.

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: Hotel guest can have 20% discount. Staff Re friendly and knowledgeable, they can explain to you very details of every one of bear. They are helpful to help you take photos. This is a place never let you down

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: We went here mainly to take pictures and to entertain the kid. The museum is situated in Doubletree Hilton , hotel guest get discounts. Upon entering the guide will walk u thru the various history and objectives of the museum. It was interesting as they told us the details that during the war no bears were happy. Subsequently they walk u thru the localised bears to take u thru culturally significant things in Penang. It is a different way of understanding local culture. Hard to get a taxi here, be prepared.

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: TeddyVille Museum is located within Double Tree Resort. There are exhibition panels describing the background behind teddy bears as well as the history and culture of Penang. However, my tour group was too excited over the adorable small teddy bears in intricate settings, where we could spot familiar sights such as Kek Lok Si Temple and discover cute details. There were also large teddy bears that we could pose with, and the friendly staff members were happy to help us take photographs. I definitely recommend this attraction for anyone who likes to take fun photographs, and I would suggest taking some extra time to read the exhibition panels too as there are learning opportunities aside from fun!

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: Lovely museum, good place for photos, a variety of bear dolls and miniature bears different scenes. The place is nice, worth a visit. Ticket prices was reasonable.

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: A really nice place to visit. Not only are the teddy bears cute but there are lots of history to be learned here.

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: This museum is lovable.  A suitable place to take pictures, a variety of bear dolls and miniature bears in several different scenes.  The place is nice and well maintained.  Ticket prices for non malaysia adults RM 36 and children RM 25

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: I had to drag my husband in as he thought it was just about Teddies. Boy was he wrong. we spent two hours in there learning about the history of Penang re enacted by Teddy Bears. I think that way it stayed in my mind rather then someone telling you about it. it was mesmerising from start to finish. you can take photos but not videos. the young man who was a curator through the museum took most of the photos so it was great having few photos together. the place needs to be advertised as a HISTORY OF PENANG THROUGH TEDDIES EYES not just TeddyVille Museum. I would highly recommend it as it is really bright, fun and enjoyable

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: We stayed at hotel and had entrance included. Teddies cute but set up as a history lesson on Penang which was really interesting. Certainly would not have been a place we would have travelled to visit but glad we had a look.

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: Some historical teddy history but mainly devoted to historic Malaysian scenes re-enacted with teddies.  May be OK for young children but for adults, it was somewhat disappointing in view of the expensive (bu local standards) entry price

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: My wife really love this place.! So many teddy bears! Cute and fun seeing them being arranged with special theme. Best for photo taking and hug the huge size soft toy teddy bear . Memorable visit trip.

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: The museum is located in Double Tree Hilton, which is on the way to Batu Ferringhi if you are coming from Georgetown. Its about a 30 minute drive from Georgetown.The museum is more extensive than I expected, and I was really surprised by the details of the small teddy bears. The history and culture, as well as several famous people of Penang is also introduced using the teddy bears, which was quite educational. Do take a lot of photos!

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: The kids really loved this place. Lots of life-sized teddies to pose with, and some cute dioramas as well. Just enough info to pass it off as educational, as well, but the kids just thought the huge teddies were cool

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: We are staying at DoubleTree Resort Penang and so decided to visit this museum.  There is a escort who will guide and explain you the history of these teddybears, and best she is very pro to take good family photos with these bears.  The bears come in different Penang history background and costumes which is so fun and cute to take picture. If you stayed at this hotel, do make your way to this museum to have some fun facts about Penang.

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: This museum is to be found at the Double Tree by Hilton Hotel.  It tells both the history of teddy bears and the history of Penang Island using the bears as the story tellers.  Easy to spend an hour or more there.

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: Not just an ordinary toy showcase but a beautiful teddy bear line up with a different twist of story telling. Just imagine a cute oversize teddy bear with the ordinary life in Penang day to day life put together. And all the photo opportunities you can have. Its just fun..

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: Really enjoyed our visit to the TeddyVille Museum. The museum features the history of teddy bears, and miniature teddy bears featuring the local culture and history of Penang. The surprising part for us was the opportunity to take pictures with life size teddy bears featuring the local culture of Penang! We get to sit behind a table pretending to have breakfast at Toh Son Cafe or posing next to a Teochew Chendul stall, and others more! We loved every moment of it and we had heaps of fun! The staff (special thanks to Yumi) was helpful. She took pictures for us as we went through the different sections.Worth a visit especially if you are in the area.

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: This is a fun place for the kids and great for photos. This is located within DoubleTree Resort, situated in a corner

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: I loved learning about the history of Penang as well as the history of the teddy bear.  I usually wouldn't go to a museum about teddy bears, however it was a very interesting visit and I'm glad we made the effort.

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: More than 30mins ride from Georgetown to Batu Ferringhi, the Double Tree by Hilton Resort where the TeddyVille Museum is situated, within the resort itself.Entrance fee is RM36 per adult for non resort guests and RM27 for resort guests. Opening hours from 9am to 6pm but last entry is at 5.15pm, lights out at 5.50pm (apparently automatically), then the merchandise store closes at 6pm. I wished they had indicated the last entry time on their website too.We arrived just after 5.15pm and since we came all the way already we just had to go through with it and had just 30 mins to rush thru the exhibit. But the staff were really kind, patiently waiting for us to finish the last photos at the reception area before locking up the place.The first part is a history of teddy bears and showcase of the stuffed toy from different eras. The early wood shaving ones to modern day wool filled ones.Then the rest of the exhibit is a display of Penang‚Äôs history, culture and landmarks (including the street art murals) thru the use of both large size and miniature teddys. I like that they really paid alot of attention to the fine details, both in the large and tiny ones, as fine as the mini flip flop slippers hanging on a cart stall by the beach. There are alot of opportunities for photos here, almost like a trick eye museum but with teddys. We had to rush thru so I wished we had at least an 1 hour, would have been more comfortable, more fun, to do more poses, more angles, even more photos. Even at and after the merchandise area, there were more to see and take! A heaven for teddy lovers.

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: TeddyVille is a novel idea and fun place to visit, particularly for families or the young at heart.A great way to spend an hour to learn about the history of teddy bears and the Malaysian culture, or to simply look at the adorable bears.TeddyVille is located within the Double Tree Resort which has on site parking which is convenient.  The bus stop from the main road is also within walking distance.Staff are friendly and will offer to take photos for you on your phone or camera.

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: After reading the reviews, we went to Teddyville museum located in Double tree resort by Hilton and it was a fantastic place for our daughter to experience the penang history explained thru teddy bears. Who knew that Jimmy Choo was from Penang !!! You can take lots of pictures with the Teddies and also the guide is very helpful in explaining the various exhibits and also clicks pictures for you.Ticket prices are on the expensive side at about RM 45 per person if you are not staying in the resort but worth the visit especially if you have young kids. We were not staying there but easy to get to if you are in Batu Ferringhi area. Parking is free and is available in the hotel.

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: This is a museum of teddy bears, located inside the double tree resort by hilton. They have various themes of teddy bears for photographing and big size teddy bears too.

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: Great for the young children. Mixed with a smattering of history, the teddies come in all shapes and sizes and in colourful settings.

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: I believe this place is pretty new because I saw a request being put up at the counter asking for reviews haha. This museum is not your typical museum. Although it is small, you will find that it will take some time to finish touring the exhibits as you will be looking very closely at the bears and busy yourself with photo taking. It is a very interesting way of presenting a historical narrative and see lots of effort has been spent into dressing the teddy bears. Whether you are a soft toy lover or not, you will find a visit to this museum enriching.

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: The Teddy Museum is inside the DoubleTree resort. If you take time to study the history of teddies and Penang you can be occupied for quite a long time. Photographs allowed including a teddy taking a selfie with you. All the teddies in the different scenes made locally.There are bigger than human size and cute littlies also a very nice shop at the end with postcards and stamps and other merchandicery ente

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: Regardless of your age, you will love this place so long as you're young at heart. Lotsa cute mini and giant Teddy bear exhibits illustrating Malaysian cultures. You can get there by bus 101 and 102 from Komtar bus terminal. Less than 45 minutes' ride. Just alight at Double Tree Resort. Go on a weekday so it's easier to take pictures without the crowd. Not a big place though, so you'll probably be done in an hour or so.

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: Interesting and fun museum full of teddy bears for you to learn and understand their history. It is situated inside Hilton resort hotel at Batu Ferringhi. If you love teddy bears, this is the place for you! Teddyville had put together a history of how teddy bears came about, when and where they were first made, their value and fused them together to introduce Penang's culture. You can take the opportunity to learn about the food and hawker culture of Penang, the people and lifestyle, places of interest, daily activities, famous food and know what's famous in Penang etc. all through teddy bears! After touring the place, indulge in getting yourself a tee, jacket, keychain, towel, magnets and teddy bear to bring home with you! A great place to visit for both young and old because if you love teddy bears, age is never a barrier at all!

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: Spent an hour one rainy afternoon looking through Teddyville museum - very impressed with the cultural history of Penang on display in a fun environment using teddy bears to depict the people of Penang.  Well worth a visit!

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: Was staying in Batu Ferringhi area so we decided to come by the museum. So happy that we did! Very adorable and very fun to pose with the teddy bears. Lots to see with a very local Malaysian flavour. Highly recommend!

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: Lots of Malaysian history. Not just Teddy bears . Information about the war and the history of Malaysia

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: When we first go in, it was really a WOW effect!!!!! Those bears are so adorable, many huge bears and scene that you can really spend 10-15 min for one section just to take photo with those cute bears!!!!!!Amazing scenes and characters with great attention to detail.Will be back for sure for the next visit to penang!!!! Must go place =)

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: Weekend staycation led us to this tucked away secret along the coast of Penang. Upon entering the museum, you will be led to the history of how Teddy Bears grew popularity around the globe and it was interesting to pick up some fun facts most people never knew. They also host a collection of teddy related souvenirs for the die hard fans, much like in a Hello Kitty shop for comparison. If you like local lore and history, or a teddy fan, this would be the place for you. Or simply if you have grumpy kids that need to hang out in an air conditioned environment. Enjoy!

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: A modern setting inside a hotel. Decoration is good too but too small to justify for Rm35 admission ticket for local adult.

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: Nice experience with all the cute teddy!!!We can experience Teddy cross with Penang cultural as well.

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: I am traditionally skeptical about locally operated attractions, but TeddyVille really takes the cake! Not only do the dioramas capture a slice of Penang, it does so quintessentially. Entering from the DoubleTree hotel lobby, TeddyVille welcomed me with bursts of colours and delightfully playful background music, setting my expectations immediate, and I wasn't disappointed. The displays are a mixture of awe and delight, I'm amazed with the level of detail. And no child can resist taking a selfie with the life sized bears.The operators and their team are so friendly, and I couldn't resist the gift shop, hands-down easily the best teddy-bear shop in Malaysia. I've visited twice already, and will still look forward to bringing my friends for another visit.

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: Wasn't really keen to start with but we had time, were at the Batu Feringghi area & thought lets do this any case. The ticket is a tad ex for Malaysia's standards (local/tourist pay different prices); BUT the experience and the set-up of the place is really one to admire. there is loads to see and if you have kids that like teddy bears, this will be a joy to their senses! Highly recommend it. There are photo opptys which you can pay for and must say that is very reasonably priced.

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: Amazing scenes and characters. Very well done with great attention to detail. Enjoyed. A great inclusion with our Luxury Escape Package.

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: Was very impressed with this little gem.  It gave a great insight into the history of the teddy bear and a historical and cultural overview of Penang by using teddy bears.  A must see.

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: it‚Äôs a good place to spend ~1-2hours, especially if you, 1) have an instagram account, and 2) love teddy bears.  it‚Äôs located inside doubletree hotel and in-house guests get a small discount on the entrance fee.  the staff here are very nice, will take time to guide you around‚Ä¶

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: Lots of teddies as you would expect and Interesting enough but not something that I would return too... the staff are super friendly but also know how to push the sales store/ gifts on exit which made it slightly uncomfortable.

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: What a nice museum with friendly staffs! All the themes are very up-to-date by showing Penang's culture! Most importantly, there's a leng zai staff aka photographer who is very professional in helping us to take nice photo! It's really worth to pay a visit! üòç

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: It‚Äôs a very enriching and interesting museum! Get to see bears that were made a hundred over years ago. There were so much stories behind all the bears. Didn‚Äôt expect much before I stepped into the museum, but it turn out to be a really interesting place. Spent hours there to‚Ä¶

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: My daughter insisted we add this to our trip and she thoroughly enjoyed it. A nice low key way to spend an hour at most.

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: You kids will definately love it! Besides the gigantic bears, there is good info about the history of Penang. After all the photo shootings, it took us less than an hour for the entire visit. Besides that, the entrance ticket is obviously too expensive! Only worth the visit if‚Ä¶

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: Lots of human size bears to take photos with, and miniatures of attractions with bears as the citizens. Not much opportunities for hugging of bears though... Good place for family with young kids who love bears or if you would like to escape the heat and take nice photos.

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: The staff were super nice to us. its a great place to take your kids. my baby had a great time. a very wide range of teddy bears to see.

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: We visited the teddy bear museum  today unless you are really into teddy bears   Don't put  it on your must see list.

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: Situated within the delightful Double Tree Resort Hilton this is such a wonderful family place to visit. We are taken through the important evolution of the bear. Then a superb display using bears to tell the unique story of Penang with bears. At the end we are treated to an‚Ä¶

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: Quite a nice place to visit. Their teddy in the museum is very attractive. Good Services to customer too.

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: Am a teddy lover despite my age and made a must visit lisit to this museum on my first trip to Penang. Been eyeing this place through instagram and finally visit this place today! We took Grab from Georgetown and was surprised that actually this museum is part of DoubleTree Hilton Hotel...the entrance fee worth it for my interest on teddy bears so cuteeeee!!! Get to take fun pictures with those teddy pose and display in a way to present and introduce Penang's Culture & Places !! They even have travel tips on the wall according to what the bear represent if you read them. In addition of course history of teddy bears! Varieties of souvenirs too! Great staff! Recommended to visit!!

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: We initially went because our daughters love Teddy bears, but we were pleasantly surprised to run into a well-curated and documented collection of teddy bears. We learnt about the history of the toy, its evolution and the work put into these cuddly companions. Not only that, we all got to learn lots about the history of Penang and its culture through elaborate and gorgeous displays of teddy bears showing festivals, costumes, food and scenes of the island. Our guide was particularly helpful and the museum shop had many interesting items for sale. Worth a visit!

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: Nice place to see all Teddy from Germany Steif, but we missed this one: we provide the visitors with the opportunity to build their very own teddy..... Not available

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: the museum located inside in the new refurbished hotel (golden tree)...ample parking...reasonable fee entrance...good services...coming with a low expectation, you'll mesmerize with the informative & innovative of the teddy bear display...it's such a fun experience...you'll learn about the history of teddy bear, the penang heritage & others inside of the museum...good service by the staff & highly recommended...

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: This is an interesting and innovative museum using teddy bears to showcase the culture and history of the island. The teddy bears on display are cute and cuddly and we had an enjoyable visit here.

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: This place it's not only about pics with cute bears, but also rich in penang,George Town and malaysia history.

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: It‚Äôs located inside Double Tree Resort. Clean museum with lots of teddies in different sizes. Visitors may get to know more about Penang through the introductions & teddies displays. There are displays of some historic & valuable teddies too. However the washroom cleanliness need to be improved.

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: Cute museum with an interesting approach to showing the history of Penang. Loved it. Even my Husband enjoyed it

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: I visited this museum with my family recently. This place is very neat. It's located inside a hotel which is unique. There's a niche collection of bears in this place. The visit starts with a room filled with classical bear collections from all over the world. We didn't realize that that's the only small part of the place since it's called a museum. In fact, the place is more than a museum, it actually tells the story about Penang... with bears. It's really cool that they have the place filled with giant sized bears to do just that. All in all, it's a great place to bring your little ones along to visit.

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: Penang is renown for its out there museums. The teddyville museum is very cute, nicely presented and gives everyone a lesson in the history of Penang as you move through the exhibit.It's a little tricky to get to with the Hilton hotel renovations going on, but not insurmountable.Probably a 45min to an hour required to get through it, depending on how long you spend in gift shop. Some great teddies to buy.Worth a visit if you have young ones into teddies.

Name: TeddyVille Museum
User Location: Kinshasa, Democratic Republic of the Congo
Comment: Teddyville is a museum full of teddies located in what will be the DoubleTree hotel in Batu Ferringhi, Penang.  It is open even though the surrounding hotel is still being worked on.  Teddyville is an excellent place for young children, especially those of an age to still find teddies wonderful.By the entrance to Teddyville is an enormous teddy, maybe 8 foot high.  It is an incredibly cuddly bear and the kind of thing a toddler will love giving a big hug to.The entrance fee is pretty reasonable, this is not an expensive place to visit.Inside the museum, most of the exhibits showcase Penang culture and history.  It is a great introduction to Penang regardless of having teddies.  The teddies are posed around key features of the island and moments in its history.  There are around ten different scenes depicted and each of them tells the story excellently backed up by good signage explaining what is being shown.The teddies themselves are in great condition and are really nice to see.  They are posed really well to give a feel of a real environment.  Key people are also depicted in teddy form.  Naturally the likeness is entirely missing but it is still a fun way to showcase a bit of historical knowledge.The first room is a bit different from the rest.  It contains teddies from history including Stieff bears and other notable stuffed toys.  This is more a room for adults to see than for kids but it is nice to see reminders of teddies from previous generations such as Teddy Ruxpin.The shop is a little disappointing and somewhat overpriced.  The biggest downside at the moment is that the hotel Teddyville is situated within is not open.  Getting in and out is hassle.  It involves walking past what is not much beyond a building site.  On top of this the bridge to the other side of the road on a busy street is closed and the bus stop on the other side does not appear to slow down passing buses.  When the hotel is open and this is a more accessible location it will be a better place to visit but even now Teddyville is excellent and a wonderful experience for young children.

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: Wonderful place . The lifesize teddy bears are great to take pictures with . It's the most adorable museum ever .

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: Just had a guided tour with Eskay, of the Teddyville Museum. A great place to visit, far bigger than I imagined. They use a very imaginative way of telling Penang's history. Anyone with children visiting Penang should visit this museum.

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: There have many teddy bear here. They design their teddy bear to let us know their's local culture there. This place has a little difficult to find it because they set a place under hotel has Construction. They open Weekend and Public Holiday only.

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: It is located in an unfinished condo. Ticket price was reasonable, but not the items sold at the gift shop. Interesting little walk with a brief history of Penang and lots of things to take a picture with!

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: It just simple of places teddy... friendly staff, but the location a bit hard to find, it near miami cafe..a bit scary when enter because the place in the renovation phase, but so far it really nice to visit

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: Okay place, but not as good as it is said to be. So when you go there, don't have too high expectations.

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: This is a great place to rediscover your childhood or for your kids to have fun. I especially the exhibits related to Penang. However they need to do something about the outside as it looks like some apartment under construction.

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: There are many advertisements regarding this tourist spot in brochure/magazine/map so we would like to stop by after visiting Batu Feringhi area.The direction is quite clear and there is a Teddy Bear sign at the corner of the road.What made us doubt is the location inside the unfinished building (apartment or hotel building is still under construction)??We were following the signs into the building and came to a small lobby with cashier register table.Wow the entrance ticket is quite expensive RM36 for adult and I needed to bargain for student price at RM29 for my two kids which they insisted to provide student ID at first. We only brought passports on holiday, not student IDs.Well... Inside we saw some exhibits with mansize teddybear dolls.Teddybears in sailor costume, in a cafe, in doctor costume, in a baker costume, chinese new year celebration, beach costume, painting batik, cooking, barber and some more.But no, we are not exciting inside. Maybe it was cool for kids to see and touch fury dolls. For us it was quite boring.Less than an hour we spent inside. The so called museum was quite empty with less than 10 people we saw inside.I guess it is only a doll shop with quite large showcase, absolutely not a museum.

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: Although I thought this trip would be predominantly for children I was surprised to find it educational and well presented. We were given a guide who explained much about the history of bears then took us through the history of Penang with interactive and static displays designed to high standards.A fun time. Highly recommend having a guide (Pary excellent) as we got so much more out of it.Don't be put off by the 'building site entrance' the museum has opened in the middle of construction of a new hotel.

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: A bit hard to get to by public transport as it appears from google maps that the rapid bus stop only stops on the opposite side of the road so if you are travelling from George Town you need to go past Miami Beach and then get off when you come back the other way. We got there by taxi which cost about 30RM from E&O hotel. We looked to see if we could have got there by bus but there was only a bus stop on the opposite side of the road. You could get there using the hop on hop off bus - Miami Beach stop. Pary was our guide and showed us around explaining everything. It was a great experience as Pary was really friendly, fun and took lots of photos for us. At only 36RM each for adults it was good value. Thanks Pary it was great fun!

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: This museum located at the underconstruction hotel. So, it is a bit creepy if you are just looking from the outside. However, you will be amazed with their interior and it is a good choice to bring your kids here. The staff / owner@manager I assume were so friendly and knowledgable on teddy's bear history. A must revisit place for anyone...

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: Visited with my gf today.. museum is very well done from teddy bear origins through to moden day. Best feature is all Penang famous areas recreated with bears.. bring a good camera or a selfie stick because your girl will want lots of photos with the life size bears, staff very friendly too.. highly recommended :)

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: Be prepared to grit your teeth and BEAR with the traffic jam if you decide to visit during festive/holiday season! The long and winding single lane traffic is famous in Batu Ferringhi.1.  Museum itself is not very big; it is housed on the ground floor of the semi-finished     Double Tree Hilton Hotel2.  Great for children and adults alike; fun facts, history, local culture, etc3.  Fun facts about Penang and their local customs4.  Famous Penangites5.  Famous landmarks6.  Local delicacies explained

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: By taking Rapidpenang buses (u101)...stop at Doubletree Hilton Hotel busstop...walk a short distance to the museum.                 Pay for a small entrance fee...here we find cuddly cutie bears of all sorts...from tiny to huge bears.                                           Imagine how much would one loves especially children of all ages...to have in their bedrooms.Not only for kids but also for those who loved these cuties bears. Pay a visit today enjoy your childhood dreams...

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: I went there mainly as I thought that it will be a nice place for my daughter to enjoy and I found myself enjoying it too. The place is very nice, neat and has lots of info about the teddy bears history. Moreover, the outlet was amazing and I was enjoying helping my daughter and wife shopping and choosing gifts. The staff are also very friendly and gives you lots of info and advice on which items are suitable for certain age and so on. I believe if you are visiting Penang with children you must visit it.

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: Great place for kids and adults who love teddy bear. Lots of cute bear where you can take photos with. Museum is located below a hotel currently under renovation and buildings surrounding are also under renovation. Place is currently open on weekends only.

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: The museum is located in a building under construction when we went on Christmas weekend. Park by the side of the road, and walk in till you come to the ticketing entrance. It is cheaper for locals who are MyKad holders. Lots of bears in local costumes and photo opportunities here. We enjoyed our visit and highly recommend it!

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: Really had so much fun !! I'm a teddy lover .. even my parents enjoy it very much .. everything was so wonderful & cute

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: Excellent with teddybears.. cute..1st teddybear musuem in malaysia..almost theme depend on penang history & cultural...Hope doubletree open next year.

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: Arriving at Doubletree by Hilton to visit Teddyville Museum Penang requires one to park on the roadside as the hotel is still in construction. The journey towards the museum was a hallway enclosed by wooden boards surrounding the renovation area. Upon reaching the entrance, a pair of teddies is greeting the tourist. Ticket prices were cheaper if you are a MyKad holder or student (remember to provide student ID). Each visitor was given a teddyville sticker to wear on. There is a huge Teddy Bear with various signs to take photos with. Upon entering the first exhibit, Mr Yeap explained on the history of teddy bears, how they were made, their evolution and some of the special teddies they have on display. Following on is the mini Penang which depicts Penang and her history by using teddies. The third Beary Famous People and cultural boardwalk revolves on the famous public figure from Penang, and culture of Penang. There are many life-sized Teddies depicting Penang culture and famous public figures around for photo taking. When it comes to Beary fun zone, the staff was accommodating and helpful by offering to take photos and giving tips on how to pose for the photos. Lastly, if you want to get hands on the beary goodies, the thematic souvenir shop would be a great stop. Overall, Teddyville Museum Penang was a beary-shiok experience suitable for all ages..

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: Fun place to hang out with friends. A lot of surprises! And can take a lot of nice pictures with the cutie teddy bears ~

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: Great experience. The staff was good explaining every details of penang history as pictured by the teddy bears. There are also history about how teddy bear got its name. Good place for kids as there are big and small teddies to see and snap photos with.

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: This museum is located at the ground floor of Double Tree Resort.  The resort itself is not completed yet and hence, i personally think that it could pose some hazards to visitors. Entrance fee for an adult is RM27 & RM15 for children (RM10 is redeemable against some souvenir) Anyway, the interior of the museum is so so with some part of the rooms are quite warm.  You can find the history of teddy bears in the beginning of the tour. Then, you can find lots of mini bears with different kind of penang tourist spots such as Kek Lok Si Temple (which i like most, the buddha's statues look almost the same as the original one), kampung lifestyle, Penang Bridge Marathon, Esplanade hawkers center and etc.  The giant bear frying char koay teow, breakfast bears and etc are nicely decorated. In the end of the tour, you will be led into a souvenir room where you can purchase your own limited edition Steiff bear.

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: What's more interesting than learning culture and history together with the cute bears around!? It's fun for the whole family, especially the kids!

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: This museum has only recently opened and it is a bit hard to find, but so worth it! You can take the 101 bus to get there and back as there is a bus stop very close to it on the main road - just make sure you know where to hop off (Google Maps is helpful). The museum has a mix of historical teddy bears, miniature teddy scenes of Penang history, and "life-size" bears that you can pose with for photos, I went alone and a helpful staff member toured me through, taking my photo at each opportunity, and giving me an informative history of Penang with local insight and anecdotes. Lots of fun!

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: A cheerful welcome and fun experience! The staff are very friendly and helpful. Get to see limited edition and antique bear. Learn a brief history of teddy bears. Mini dioramas made with small details and full of creativity depicting the colours of Penang. You can take photos with the bigger bears too! Overall a joyful time for someone who loves their teddy friends.

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: Bought my family and kids to the Teddy Museum, the environment was so pleasant,  service was great and friendly staffs. Various of bears in different customs and culture , displaying the heritage and stories of this beautiful Island. Our kids love it. For those Bear's lovers this is certainly a right place for you.  We were so so obsessing in photos taking and their souvenirs are so cute.  Will definitely recommend to my friends and relatives to visit the musuem.

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: Very well curated museum with plenty of visuals.  Teddy bears dressed up in all sorts of costumes, very well arranged and enjoyed it.No regrets for 1st timers, fantastic and if you have not visit this museum, you have not seen penang completely.A MUST GO.....i love it there, will bring my daughter again soon. She loves it too much!!

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: First of its kind museum to open in Penang which pays tribute to Teddy bears from around the world as well as the history and uniqueness of Penang itself. A definite must visit for at least once!

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: Bought pre launch ticket package that cw a good quality dry fit teddy tee for my kid. Is a good experience for my family. Cute is not the only word for this establishment but lotsa hardwork and detail to gather and put up such an exclusive display. Worth to visit and bet all the kids will want to have their hands on those variety of teddies at the store on the way out.

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: First Teddy museum in Penang. pleasure environment, cute and unique bear bear around in our Penang famous tourist areas. is a nice place to spend and enjoy with our love one...Helpful and smiling staff as well..  :)

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: I purchased the ticket and t-shirt package since last year and had been wasting desperately. I have always been a huge teddy bear fans and have collected personally more than 50 bears at home. Thinking of staying in the hotel to ease my visit to the museum initially, the hotel not able to open yet. Now they opened during weekend only. The way to the museum is a bit tricky and luckily there wad an uncle who showed us the entrance. The staffs are friendly and we were guided along the way to exit. Special thanks to ayen who enthusiastically introduced pg to us. Im astonished by the collection of steiff teddy bear collection with the earliest one from 1902. I liked the way teddy bear were utilized to introduce pg in a way to promote penang culture. All the miniature and figurine are really unique and tediously made. Even the bears are made of high quality material. I bought mr beary at the retail shop as well. As a result of the delay in opening, they compensate by giving us another 2 ticket for next visit. I hope that by that time we get to stay in the hotel.

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: Very unique museum and cute teddy bears dressed up in all sort of costumes. It has many stations, teddy bears dishing dishes in hawker centres. Teddy bears celebrating Chinese New Year. Teddy bears celebrating Hari Raya! Good reflection of all cultural backgrounds together working in harmony.  Very educational for kids and surprisingly also entertaining for the adults! The layout of the museum is very well thought out! There is something to gain for everyone who visits. A must go!

Name: TeddyVille Museum
Comment: A fun & great place for all to learn about the history of Penang. Kids & those young at heart will definitely enjoy the nicely curated teddy bears which depicts Penang in an interesting way....

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden
Address: 336 Jalan Tokong Thai Pak Koong, Tanjung Bungah
Comment: Lighting setup was brilliant and pictures are captured beautifully. Paid RM5 for parking entrance. No fee for the temple entrance.

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden
Address: 336 Jalan Tokong Thai Pak Koong, Tanjung Bungah
Comment: Not recommended. Imagine the parking hassle, and having to pay RM5 for it and you end up spending only about 15 mins at most walking around. That‚Äôs all. Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden

Comment: A good place to drop by when you're near to this place. You'll see trees hanging with lights, led flowers etc. But the parking space is a bit limited. Overall ok.

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden
Address: 336 Jalan Tokong Thai Pak Koong, Tanjung Bungah
Comment: I have heard a lot about this place from my friends and I finally had a chance to visit it. This place has horrible parking and before you enter you will need to pay a small maintenance fee. Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden
Address: 336 Jalan Tokong Thai Pak Koong, Tanjung Bungah
Comment: üíØ to whoever it was, who conceptualised what he read & saw, to design this garden, and put it on the tourist map. Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden
Address: 336 Jalan Tokong Thai Pak Koong, Tanjung Bungah
Comment: We saw this attraction advertised so thought we would give it a try as it was not far from where we were staying. It`s not too far past Tesco . Go at night if in the vicinity but don`t make a special trip to see as it`s not great. There was a man collecting MYR 1 per person and‚Ä¶

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden
Address: 336 Jalan Tokong Thai Pak Koong, Tanjung Bungah

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden
Address: 336 Jalan Tokong Thai Pak Koong, Tanjung Bungah
Comment: It is hard to get a parking and the only things can do is be careful while walking on the dark road and stairs. Still can take a nice photo there but nothing else can do

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden
Address: 336 Jalan Tokong Thai Pak Koong, Tanjung Bungah

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden
Address: 336 Jalan Tokong Thai Pak Koong, Tanjung Bungah

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden
Address: 336 Jalan Tokong Thai Pak Koong, Tanjung Bungah

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden
