Comment: A small garden with beautiful lightings that located next to a Chinese temple.  Not suitable for elderly and toddlers as it is very dark and you need to climb up many flights of stairs.  We have our dinner at the only seafood cafe situated next to the garden. There were few food stalls and each selling different kind of food.   We have to order 5 kg of crabs which is a MUST in order to dine in the cafe.  We also have satays, fried rice, mee hoon, hor fen, 4 different kinds of veg, fried lala etc.  The food taste sucks. Even those street food vendors in Penang can cook much better than them.  All the seafood were not fresh,  veg were raw n hard to chew.  Fried rice & mee hoon were very dry & salty,  hor fen full of starch.  Pay abt $1000 Riggit for TERRIBLE food!  NEVER DINE IN THIS PLACE!!

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden
Address: 336 Jalan Tokong Thai Pak Koong, Tanjung Bungah
Comment: The garden is full with colourful lighting that make it really beautiful and amazing like being in the movie. It's a good place to visit for both adult and children.

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden
Address: 336 Jalan Tokong Thai Pak Koong, Tanjung Bungah
Comment: There are a bunch of old men guarding entrance to the location in front of Chinese temple. I guess they are from the temple. All visitors are demanded to pay RM1 per head. Either on foot or drop off.I just left coz one of them threatened and shouted when I refused to pay after aligned from Grab.

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden
Address: 336 Jalan Tokong Thai Pak Koong, Tanjung Bungah
Comment: Visited the place with family at night. Different age group have different thoughts as I thought the lights were spectacular, but my parents, who are in their 50s, found it boring and tedious cause of the amount of stairs to climb.The place is kind of inconvenient to  visit if you don't have a personal transport, and it is located together with a Chinese temple. Before you reach the temple, you will need to enter a small lane surrounded by the local houses. Hence, I think it's normal if you suspect if your gps is working well or not.When I was there with my family, each person need to pay RM1 for entrance. For those who are going to drive there. Please take note there's limited space for you to park. Unless you do not mind parking at the beach which is at the front of the temple.

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden
Address: 336 Jalan Tokong Thai Pak Koong, Tanjung Bungah
Comment: Can't wait to share this with tourist fellow. Don't go to the only seafood restaurant at Avatar! The seafood stall owner is super rude! No reserve, no table, he said. We saw a few empty table. When we were about to leave, he lured us back IF we bought crab from him. Fine with us as there was no choice and we were hungry already. They way he took order is forceful! Forcing us to buy 5kg of crab! Then we order 2 kg of crab, fried prawn, fried oyster, and fried rice/bihun/kwetiau (different stall). The crab and prawn still tasted fishy! The fried bihun/kwetiau was so horrible - like it was only showered with salt water only! The price was not cheap, horrible taste and super rude seafood owner - this is the worst experience in my Penang trip! About the garden itself, we only went to first stop only. It is dark stairs to go up and very crowded (Saturday nite), so we decided not to continue going up.

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden
Address: 336 Jalan Tokong Thai Pak Koong, Tanjung Bungah
Comment: Go there by evening, it is a hidden secret garden of penang. enjoy the sunset then enjoy the lighting, if you like Avatar, you will like this place.

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden
Address: 336 Jalan Tokong Thai Pak Koong, Tanjung Bungah
Comment: Mostly young people on the night we were there, and I guess most nights too. We had dinner at Indochine nearby and decided to walk there and got a Grab back to our hotel. Lucky we did, the place is at the end of a residential area, it was crowded and street so narrow it would have been near impossible. Smoke from a temple and a restaurant at the end made it even more sweltering hot. Following the uneven path besides the temple we came to steps that were insufficiently lit, leading us up the hill into a platform centred around a big tree lit with hanging led lights. There were more paths further up and going around the back with more lighting. It is a small garden, though I can see some resemblance but it‚Äôs still a far cry from The Avatar garden.Still I can see the attraction of the lights, especially for the young and romantic..

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden
Address: 336 Jalan Tokong Thai Pak Koong, Tanjung Bungah
Comment: You are transformed into a magical garden at night with it's beautiful lighting. The lights hanging down from the tree changes its colour. It's a great place for photography. But do mind your steps because certain area can be quite dark so use the torchlight from your handphone to shine the steps. During the daytime there's the Tua Pek Kong temple that's open for visitors to offer prayer. During Tsunami, most shops and stuffs were washed out to sea but the temple remain standing firm on its ground thus this invites lots of devotees and tourists. There's also a chinese reataurant that serves seafood.

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden
Address: 336 Jalan Tokong Thai Pak Koong, Tanjung Bungah
Comment: Our kids really enjoyed it. It‚Äôs quite a small attraction but the lights are very cool and make for great photographs. Just don‚Äôt go to the seafood / crab restaurant nearby - the food there is really substandard and expensive.

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden
Address: 336 Jalan Tokong Thai Pak Koong, Tanjung Bungah
Comment: Yes its pretty and the lights were amazing and looked just like the avatar jungles in the movie especially when it moved in the breeze from the sea! But its a really small park and the entry is through a residential area. No signs anywhere. They charge 1RM. Not much else to do so you can skip this place or visit on the way to and from Batu Feringhi maybe. Easy to reach by bus though, just get down at Tanjong Tokong flats.

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden
Address: 336 Jalan Tokong Thai Pak Koong, Tanjung Bungah
Comment: A Chinese temple switch on light at night. Place for take photo, joy for family and friends, and romance for couple. Besdies lighting show and seafood restaurant, there was nothing.   PS: entrance fee is FOC. 5MYR for car parking.

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden
Address: 336 Jalan Tokong Thai Pak Koong, Tanjung Bungah
Comment: Thoroughly enjoyed the garden. Loved the lights and it was like the movie avatar. It was magical. There were also other features like the manicured bonsai/hedge garden with stone carved animals by the beach. My boy loved it

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden
Address: 336 Jalan Tokong Thai Pak Koong, Tanjung Bungah
Comment: You need to across narrow road just would reach there. Parking fee is required. Lighting effect on tree.

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden
Address: 336 Jalan Tokong Thai Pak Koong, Tanjung Bungah
Comment: Not worth it for a trip there as there‚Äôs really nothing spectacular. Dinner at the seafood establishment (more like a coffee shop run by residents) was unsatisfactory. The boss insisted we order crabs or we can‚Äôt dine there. There was little variety in their food selections.‚Ä¶

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden
Address: 336 Jalan Tokong Thai Pak Koong, Tanjung Bungah
Comment: Found it a pretty once off kinda experience as the lights were pretty to look at. Mum however found it too dark to walk around, and wheelchair-bound grandpa didn't get to enjoy the lights. (The ground is of gravelled stone and sand.) It took half an hour to make a round‚Ä¶

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden
Address: 336 Jalan Tokong Thai Pak Koong, Tanjung Bungah
Comment: Its free and its different. So worth going for picture purposes. Parking was ample. But be sure to bring mosquitoes repellent.

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden
Address: 336 Jalan Tokong Thai Pak Koong, Tanjung Bungah
Comment: Went on a busy weekend, during Raya holidays. Traffic was horrible, but fortunately I did not drive. I parked my car at Hotel Sentral Seaview a bit up the road and walked the rest of the way. Parking underground is free, there is nothing to block you from going in even if you are not a hotel guest.Otherwise, parking at the attraction itself is RM5, charged by locals there. Then another RM1 "maintenance fee" per person.

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden
Address: 336 Jalan Tokong Thai Pak Koong, Tanjung Bungah
Comment: The decorations at night was a good one. Very special. A stone's throw away from the Viva Local Food Haven.

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden
Address: 336 Jalan Tokong Thai Pak Koong, Tanjung Bungah
Comment: Brilliant idea and I do enjoy the lighting effects and ambiance. It is great to come during the night time and the effect will be more real. Try to avoid the peak time/long holidays as there will be difficult to find a parking spots and you may need to walk from the parking lots before you could reach the entrance.Do ensure you wear a proper shoes and comfy outwear as it could be quite stuffy and you can spend around 20 - 45 minutes here, especially for those who are into photography.

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden
Address: 336 Jalan Tokong Thai Pak Koong, Tanjung Bungah
Comment: The place is not worth going anymore. Rude caretakers plus atmosphere is not the same anymore. They are charging entrance fee RM 1 which is ridiculous from the beginning. It is not that I can't pay for it. It is the way they are taking advantage of the public property which is not theirs. They explained to me that due to a change of government (From BN to PR) which is ridiculous and they implemented it since Nov 2017 (before government is changed). So their mind changed from non-money oriented to money oriented. If you argued against them, they will turn into gangsters and started threatening me. Felt cheated all these years local peoples promoting this beautiful place has turned to their greed. I am not recommending this place anymore. End of story

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden
Address: 336 Jalan Tokong Thai Pak Koong, Tanjung Bungah
Comment: Great place for short detour when you are in tanjung bungah, penang. This place were light up to resemble the AVATAR movie with trees and walkway were light up in different colour. There are no entrance fee, only a parking fee of RM5. The light will be lit at around 7.30 pm. So its best to visit this place at night.

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden
Address: 336 Jalan Tokong Thai Pak Koong, Tanjung Bungah
Comment: Great little garden that sits about 6km away from Georgetown. We visited at about 8:30pm when all of the lights had come on and makes the garden look stunning especially the centre piece of the tree and the lights in the flowers around the outside. There is also a tower at the garden site that you can climb up, as well as the beach which has a few statues and trees. Also if you walk a bit further round you can see the apartment blocks towering up and the reflections they create in the sea are beautiful. Despite only being small, this garden is definitely worth a visit! You can get there by bus or to get a grab taxi is only 10 RM each way!

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden
Address: 336 Jalan Tokong Thai Pak Koong, Tanjung Bungah
Comment: RM1 per entry, RM5 for parkingWent about 6pm. Waited for sunset. Once sun sets, the lighting of the Secret Garden starts. Worth the effort to set up the lighting. Amazing. Should go if nearby this area. Many visitors.

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden
Address: 336 Jalan Tokong Thai Pak Koong, Tanjung Bungah
Comment: Enjoyed the gardens, we went at dusk so got to see the topiary as well as the extensive lights of its secret garden.  It cost 1Rg per person.. very cheap.

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden
Address: 336 Jalan Tokong Thai Pak Koong, Tanjung Bungah
Comment: Well what a treasure this is. Getting there is also fascinating experiencing the local culture and way of life. Even in day light most enjoyable but must be seen at night to capture that special secret.

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden
Address: 336 Jalan Tokong Thai Pak Koong, Tanjung Bungah
Comment: The garden is small but fun and delightful particularly for young children.The area is not suitable for wheelchairs or strollers as it is mainly stairs.The downside is that although the garden is advertised as free, there are rude, overbearing, demanding, intimidating men who bully you into paying a fee. The fee is low but that's not the point. The horrible experience, provided by the standover men collecting money at the entrance, particularly as a family with three very young children made it feel creepy and unsafe.

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden
Address: 336 Jalan Tokong Thai Pak Koong, Tanjung Bungah
Comment: Went there for the first time. A few men at the main road guided me to park my car along the housing area side roads. I parked my car and they collected a fee to take care of my car. You have to pay them, they will ask from you. We didn't know how deep the garden cum temple was, luckily it wasn't too far in, but there were parking spaces in the temple. Why I write this? My car was scratched by another moving car and the man taking care of my car just walked away when I return to my car later that night. I suggest you to park inside if there's space.Entrance fee to the garden was 1 ringgit. You get to see the lights hanging from trees, getting the avatar feel. Take some photos and leave immediately. It was warm at night maybe because it was close to the sea.Don't stay to eat seafood at that place. It was the worst seafood meal ever. The service was terrible. The stall owners fought for business and was rude to customers, forcing people to order from them.

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden
Address: 336 Jalan Tokong Thai Pak Koong, Tanjung Bungah
Comment: best place for visit at penang. should visit at night. around 8-12.. because the lighting so beautiful. and also can see the sunset. between the temple.

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden
Address: 336 Jalan Tokong Thai Pak Koong, Tanjung Bungah
Comment: entrance fee is just a ringgit which i thought was greatly low! but then the entire place wasn't all that impressive. there were beautiful lights of course, like seen in the pictures but there weren't much. also you're probably going to come across a bunch of models?/celebs? taking  pictures there like they own the place (e.g; they were busy taking photos and literally blocked the main path and when we wanted to go pass them, they said "uh excuse me" and we had to take another small path lol)also it's all stairs so if you don't have the stamina or are in a wheelchair, this place might not be for you!

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden
Address: 336 Jalan Tokong Thai Pak Koong, Tanjung Bungah
Comment: This place is worth Visit if you wanted to have a nice photo with a different theme. I would highly recommended you guys to visit this place especially at night because the lights at night is the main attraction of the whole ideas in it. Try to find the best angle and you will surely get the best photos with the beautiful lighting.

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden
Address: 336 Jalan Tokong Thai Pak Koong, Tanjung Bungah
Comment: Entrance fees was cheap but not easy to get parking. It was creative but too little. I expected more deco. It's a small place. We spent less than 1/2 an hour.

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden
Address: 336 Jalan Tokong Thai Pak Koong, Tanjung Bungah
Comment: The place is just located besides our stay at Tanjung Bungah. It is very easy to access, there had a parking area provided. You need to walk a bit to reached the area. Suggestion for the best time to visit this place is at night for the best photos and feels. Just find the best angle and snap for the interesting and beautiful picture. I just love the creative idea of this place as they put numerous beautiful lighting and it's produces a majestic lighting and feelings.

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden
Address: 336 Jalan Tokong Thai Pak Koong, Tanjung Bungah
Comment: I was recommended by local chef to come here and since passing on way I decided visit.Entrance one ringgit and if park its 5 riggit

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden
Address: 336 Jalan Tokong Thai Pak Koong, Tanjung Bungah
Comment: Well I enjoyed it! I found it very beautiful. Hard to find, it should say you enter through the temple gate. There are no signs, but once it is dark and the lights come on, it's not hard to spot! So it is not huge, but very creatively designed so you can walk around and get totally different views. Plus many of the lights are constantly changing. So well worth the visit for me!

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden
Address: 336 Jalan Tokong Thai Pak Koong, Tanjung Bungah
Comment: It is just a LED stream around the park , no entrance fee needed but i bet you gona pay high price car park. It normally lights up at 7pm and should be worth visit for only once

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden
Address: 336 Jalan Tokong Thai Pak Koong, Tanjung Bungah
Comment: This set up is way too small to be an attraction.  The Led lightings are nice but the overall park is just not elaborate enough to create any excitement. Go have a look if you happen to be in the vicinity but don't bother if you intend to make a trip there hoping to be Wow.  Also, the so-call seafood restaurant there is poorly set up.  Food is really not good at all.  We order the baked crabs and prawns, but these supposedly popular items are rather tasteless.  The noodles and veg we ordered also tasted flat.  Other items were also less than average.  I'm not one who criticise much about food, but this seafood place is quite a let down.

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden
Address: 336 Jalan Tokong Thai Pak Koong, Tanjung Bungah
Comment: This place locate at the beach side area. Lot of tree, at the hill, so have to stairs climbing. Very attractive, especially for kids. The led light change to different colors in a few seconds. To route to reach there, have to pass by a residence area, so don't go too fast. It's free entrance, just parking fee which is RM 5.00. It's a nice place, should come and visit this place.

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden
Address: 336 Jalan Tokong Thai Pak Koong, Tanjung Bungah
Comment: A beautiful garden with amazing lighting- it is very mystical and so children and adults alike will find it a worthwhile visit. We were charged 1RM each to enter, plus 5RM for parking, but certainly worth it.

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden
Address: 336 Jalan Tokong Thai Pak Koong, Tanjung Bungah
Comment: The nice and romantic place with great illumination. It is better to visit it in the evening. Google says this Garden is closed on 12.00 AM, but is it not true) We came after midnight and it was open.

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden
Address: 336 Jalan Tokong Thai Pak Koong, Tanjung Bungah
Comment: This is not a large attraction. The price is 1 RM/person which is worth the time. It is a place to take lots of photos. The lights change colour continuously and give the feel of Avatar.  It is next to the beach so come down and let the ocean water wash your feet.

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden
Address: 336 Jalan Tokong Thai Pak Koong, Tanjung Bungah
Comment: We loved it.  We got there well before sunset and despite other's claims we were never charged to be there (FREE!).  We also caught the bus which means we didn't have parking fees either.As the sun set and things got darker the lights started illuminating the gardens in a magical deserving of it's name.  We took about 200 photos and a video or three.My only complaint is the lack of decent food/drink.  There was a lovely old lady who sold us a bottle of cold water for 1MYR but the other outlets there were off putting so we headed back into town (by 102 bus) for a feed on the way home to our condo.

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden
Address: 336 Jalan Tokong Thai Pak Koong, Tanjung Bungah
Comment: A bit off the beaten track, the avatar secret gardens are easily reached by uber or grab. Definitely recommend visiting at night, as the main draw is the light decoration. Not a very long walk, but very impressive. Worth a visit if you have time. RM1/pp

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden
Address: 336 Jalan Tokong Thai Pak Koong, Tanjung Bungah
Comment: Probably would be better if left regulated, as parking is chaotic and been charge rm5 meanwhile the entrance is rm1. The light display and the sea wave sound is indeed the highlight.

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden
Address: 336 Jalan Tokong Thai Pak Koong, Tanjung Bungah
Comment: The locals there are quite rude, and they extort money for parking and entrance. If you don't pay or demand for any official documents, they will gang up on you and follow you out while cursing and swearing.I would have loved to write a good review but the locals ruined my entire experience.

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden
Address: 336 Jalan Tokong Thai Pak Koong, Tanjung Bungah
Comment: Beautiful at night. Get there early just after 7pm and stay on for the lights. Park near to the beach at the temple. It is only a short walk up the small hill but it a perfect place for pictures. My pictures turned out very beautiful. They looked better than in the reviews I saw.

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden
Address: 336 Jalan Tokong Thai Pak Koong, Tanjung Bungah
Comment: Yes it‚Äôs a new attraction which just came up in 2017. But once you reach there and viewed the lights, it‚Äôs not worth the trip there. The LED lights on the trees are slightly mystical- looking but nothing special. You need to climb some flight of stairs to reach the top, but cannot see any view as it‚Äôs in the night. Can skip this attraction if time is tight. Otherwise, time spent here is about 15-20mins.

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden
Address: 336 Jalan Tokong Thai Pak Koong, Tanjung Bungah
Comment: My fiance took me here last week because I enjoy photography. Never knew of this place before. The downfall is the parking area man, they charge you RM5 to park near the flats, and the traffic around the parking area is crazy. If you enjod LED lights or photography, you should visit the place.

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden
Address: 336 Jalan Tokong Thai Pak Koong, Tanjung Bungah
Comment: Located at the Tanjung Tokong Tua Pek Kong Temple,  this is a new attraction. LED lights strung from a huge tree have been created to look like the tree in Pandora. It is a commendable effort and looks impressive lit up in the evening. The attraction is quite small and takes a bit of navigation down/up stairs. If you run out of things to do, you can visit this place coupled with an evening stroll along the beach and have a dinner at the seafood restaurant located at the temple grounds.

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden
Address: 336 Jalan Tokong Thai Pak Koong, Tanjung Bungah
Comment: Me and my friend visit Avatar Secret Garden for free entrance but must pay RM5 for parkingüôÑ There so unique haha I like it but yahh hard to take a good picture with no enough lighting. But we make it good. You guys should try with good phone camera with no flash, and need to add another two flash for both side. And the result is so boom!

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden
Address: 336 Jalan Tokong Thai Pak Koong, Tanjung Bungah
Comment: colourful lighting ... could improve much better ! There are more needed to do with varieties of lighting in many areas in the garden

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden
Address: 336 Jalan Tokong Thai Pak Koong, Tanjung Bungah
Comment: Read about this on the Internet so we went there by Grab car. Just cost RM10 from Hotel Jen. It‚Äôs actually a very small park near the beach, I‚Äôd say the locals are smart to create this Avatar theme by lighting up the place with changing LED lights to create a mysterious atmosphere. Took us 15min to walk around and snap a few pics of the tree lights and LED tulips. No complaints here since it‚Äôs a free attraction. You can come early to just walk around the beach while there is some light, then proceed to the garden once it‚Äôs lit up, around 730pm, hang around for 10-15min then go for dinner b4 the crowd comes in after dinner and jam up the place.

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden
Address: 336 Jalan Tokong Thai Pak Koong, Tanjung Bungah
Comment: Lighting wise was fibe. A little dark along the walk way. Remember to park your car in front of temple rather than some guys try to ask u park at malay village and pay rm5. U can drive in.

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden
Address: 336 Jalan Tokong Thai Pak Koong, Tanjung Bungah
Comment: The place is colorful with light decoration in the evening. You should visit in the evening to enjoy it !!!

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden
Address: 336 Jalan Tokong Thai Pak Koong, Tanjung Bungah
Comment: It‚Äôs just a place where the chinese community there decorated the place with LEDs in hope to pull tourists. They will charge the local tourists and tourists brought in by locals admission fee. As of 17th Nov, they charge RM1. Not sure about parking rate if any. Nothing to see if you‚Äôve been to i-City in Klang Valley. Bring mosquito repellent if you insist on coming no matter what.

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden
Address: 336 Jalan Tokong Thai Pak Koong, Tanjung Bungah
Comment: Led lights...luminous paint....not sure what is there to shout about...Waste of my timeI will not go n ask any1 else to as well

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden
Address: 336 Jalan Tokong Thai Pak Koong, Tanjung Bungah
Comment: The lights are very well set out best Togo at night to see all the light very crowed not very god for anyone that‚Äôs disabled ast the lots of stairs.

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden
Address: 336 Jalan Tokong Thai Pak Koong, Tanjung Bungah
Comment: Avatar secret garden is a garden full with led lamp and colourful trees decorate nicely like in avatar story. its nice and i suggest to visit at night if u like to enjoy the avatar garden.

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden
Address: 336 Jalan Tokong Thai Pak Koong, Tanjung Bungah
Comment: mysterious attraction now in Tanjung Tokong, Penang, which is the Avatar Garden! I and my family mange to visit this area with lots of crowds who wish to enjoy the view as well.

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden
Address: 336 Jalan Tokong Thai Pak Koong, Tanjung Bungah
Comment: To view the avatar like night lights display, best visit them at night when its not raining. The location is next to the seaside. The place is not wheelchair friendly, as you need to climb the stairs and walk along the walk ways to enjoy the garden. Parking space may be limited in the area, There are parking "punters" before you enter the compound to "assist" you with finding parknig spaces outside the area. A short 5 mins walk into the garden if you park here. They would charge RM5 if parked there.

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden
Address: 336 Jalan Tokong Thai Pak Koong, Tanjung Bungah
Comment: If you have patience to climb up the stairs with jam packed of people, this is a place for you. The light is beautiful and you can feel like you are being transport to Pandora and became one of the Avatar clan. But, the place is quite small only one big tree being cover with the light. Good news, it's free ( only pay for car park). Not that worth it.

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden
Address: 336 Jalan Tokong Thai Pak Koong, Tanjung Bungah
Comment: So much to see ,very informative and educational for the whole family.Good time to visit is in the morning when it isn't raining Would be very busy during school term with school groups.We spent a good two hours looking around and taking pictures. we could have spent longer You can get there on the public transport but we booked a taxi then we were dropped right at the entrance. Glad we did as there is quite a lot of walking!

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden
Address: 336 Jalan Tokong Thai Pak Koong, Tanjung Bungah
Comment: A great place to bring your kids here or for photo taking. Coming in on weekends or public/school holidays will be crazy too as it's quite hot and packed.

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden
Address: 336 Jalan Tokong Thai Pak Koong, Tanjung Bungah
Comment: Beautiful garden with avatar like lighting theme, we went there at  almost 11pm, by 11.30pm they shut all the lights..The entrance is quite narrow from the housing nearby area. Great for photoshoot also as the garden are near by the beach

Name: Penang Avatar Secret Garden
Address: 336 Jalan Tokong Thai Pak Koong, Tanjung Bungah
Comment: The Avatar inspired garden is actually a temple with beautiful nostalgic lights reminding visitors of the 2009 Avatar blockbuster movie. Artfully hung LED lights trail from branches of huge trees, with the trees itself sporting different hues of colour to contrast with the branches- resulting in a 'solar eclipse' look for certain trees. Rest shacks are generously found throughout the gardens with very comfortable wooden benches- you will need these if you intend to explore the whole park. The floor is also alight with fluorescent flowers, while various statues (cobra statue, Chinese Gods statues etc.) can be spotted once you have shifted attention away from the trees to look at the garden as a whole. Hawker food is abundant as well.The only and biggest downside of this attraction is the difficulty in reaching this place. It is a very underdeveloped area and it is NOT easy at all to get Uber drivers in this remote location (forget taxis). If you are driving, there is also very limited parking spots as, besides the temple car park, the rest of the place is a residential area where parking is not allowed. The garden is enjoyable and a nice surprise is that it is right by a scenic beach too, but be prepared to have a lot of patience when it comes to commuting to and forth.
